title: SCP-6689-3
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:basalt hidetitle=a]]

[[div class="notation"]]
> + Labyrinthine Forms:

> * **Unicursal - The Winding Path**
> * __[[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6689/offset/1|Multicursal - The Maze]]]__
> * __[[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6689/offset/3|Rhizomatic - The Web]]]__
-----

[[include :scp-wiki:component:image-block
| name=http://scpdsandbox.wdfiles.com/local--files/collab%3Adodo-maze/UniPath.gif
|align=left
| caption= Visual representation of navigation through a unicrusal labyrinth, from the perspective of the labyrinthe-viewer.]]

The simplest of the labyrinthine forms, a unicursal labyrinth may be envisioned as a winding path. This labyrinth forbids branches and intersections, thereby limiting the navigational choices made by the labyrinth-walker. However, this individual still retains agency over their willingness to continue following the path, turn around, or stop moving through the space.

Such a labyrinth requires the navigator to trust in its design: they cannot decide upon their own path, only whether to follow the one laid before them.

Despite its simplicity, this can remain a disorienting experience for the wanderer, lacking -- as they may -- a clear sense of where they are in relation to the entrance, exit, or individual segmentations of the labyrinth.
[[>]]
Dr. Adamore, Site-184,
Applied Metaphysics.
[[/>]]
[[/div]]
author: DodoDevil
